intro: Pulicaria ehrenbergiana, commonly known as the desert groundsel, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features gray-green, woolly leaves and produces small, yellow flowers clustered in flat-topped inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Pulicaria ehrenbergiana is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
